block.p: Hester Gai-bigg Wong, a daughter of Jane M. Wong and Dr. Kai Wai K. Wong of Lawrence, Kan., is to be married today to Michael Chia-Hao Chang, a son of Ferng-Yuan Chang and Hing-Ho Chang of Hicksville, N.Y. The Rev. George W. Rutler will officiate at the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour in Manhattan.
The couple met at the University of Pennsylvania, from which they graduated, he magna cum laude.

The bride, 28, received an M.B.A. this month from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. In August, she is to become a stock research associate at Merrill Lynch in Manhattan. Her mother is an associate professor of interior design at the University of Kansas at Lawrence. The bride's father retired as a professor of physics there; he is now the chairman and chief executive of Cheerpole Limited, a real estate development and investment partnership in Lawrence.

Hester Gai-bigg Wong, a daughter of Jane M. Wong and Dr. Kai Wai K. Wong of Lawrence, Kan., is to be married today to Michael Chia-Hao Chang, a son of Ferng-Yuan Chang and Hing-Ho Chang of Hicksville, N.Y. The Rev. George W. Rutler will officiate at the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour in Manhattan.
The couple met at the University of Pennsylvania, from which they graduated, he magna cum laude.

The bride, 28, received an M.B.A. this month from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. In August, she is to become a stock research associate at Merrill Lynch in Manhattan. Her mother is an associate professor of interior design at the University of Kansas at Lawrence. The bride's father retired as a professor of physics there; he is now the chairman and chief executive of Cheerpole Limited, a real estate development and investment partnership in Lawrence.

The bridegroom, 27, is the associate at JLL Partners, a leveraged-buyout fund in Manhattan. He received an M.B.A. from Harvard. His mother is a manager of Internet advertising at The World Journal, a Chinese-language daily in Whitestone, Queens. His father is a computer programmer in management information systems at Nassau Community College in Garden City, N.Y.
